intro: Broussonetia papyrifera var. integrifolia, commonly known as paper mulberry, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to East Asia. It is characterized by its alternate, simple, and often palmately lobed leaves that are usually smooth and entire. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by fluffy, white or pale pink fruit clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or scrub habitats. Its fibrous bark and leaves have been historically used in traditional crafts and papermaking.
